recommendations.recommendation: It`s cute, but don`t be fooled - it`s a very funny series of short episodes about a fat cat doing cat things. Give it a try. If you DO have a cat (a REAL one, flesh`n`bones), you will feel quite identified with this anime anyway :)
Always amusing and lighthearted. The creator obviously loves, understands (as much as anyone can understand) and has lived with cats. If you love cats, put this on your `must see` list.

anime.description: One day, in Sakura town, the slightly tipsy http://anidb.net/ch39210 [Satou Moe] stumbled into a round cushion-shaped thing that turned out to be the cat http://anidb.net/ch39206 [Poyo]. It was a fated encounter, so Moe adopted the stray. Many small daily-life adventures await the Satou family: Moe, her brother http://anidb.net/ch39208 [Hide] (a high school student), father http://anidb.net/ch39209 [Shigeru] (a farmer) and the mysterious, at times fast, high-jumping, gentle and very cute Poyo, who even likes to take baths. — written by foo2

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: tsukkomi
tag.description: A tsukkomi is a comedy duo stock character in a traditional Japanese slapstick stand-up comedy style known as manzai. Tsukkomi characters are the smart, reasonable, and down-to-earth half of the unit; their simple-minded counterparts are the http://anidb.net/t1399 [boke] characters. As a result of their boke counterparts` simple mistakes and gross exaggerations, tsukkomi berate and abuse them both verbally and physically; a very common example of tsukkomi physical abuse is a paper fan slap, which is generally accompanied by a sound effect. Their approximate equivalent in Western culture is the comedy role of straight man.

tag.name: seinen
tag.description: Seinen, literally "young man", is one of the main demographic classifications applied to manga, and, by extension, to anime, especially manga-based ones. As the name implies, seinen works are marketed primarily to an audience of young men; the age range commonly understood to be the target of such works goes roughly from 17 to somewhere in the 40s.

tag.name: animal sidekick
tag.description: Every mahou shoujo anime needs them, the cute little critters that are supposed to help the protagonists but in reality are nothing but useless bystanders most often abused for gags. Kids love them but they can also often turn into an annoyance.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: super deformed
tag.description: A caricature style often seen in anime when the character shows extreme emotions, like fear, anger, happiness, surprise, or shame. Seen as cute, as part of humorous comedy. The character`s http://anidb.net/t4055 [face suddenly turns into a simplified version], the body will usually also deform into that of a small child (oversized head, short limbs, extra-large tears).

tag.name: slapstick
tag.description: Slapstick humour is generally recognized by lots of physical abuse, horseplay and practical jokes. Also often seen are impossible situations, using sounds to illustrate impossible stunts that aren`t shown on-screen and to create tension for audience anticipation.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: daily life
tag.description: The antics of the protagonists do not take place in some exotic setting or time, but in everyday life. When not "at the job" this means getting up in the morning, making meals, house cleaning, going shopping or out to eat, visiting the bath house or spa, leisure activities in the spare time, etc. The time "on the job" for students is School Life, for others working in their profession. Daily Life is basically a synonym for everything normal, repetitive, and trivial happening to your average person.

tag.name: heart-warming
tag.description: The story and its characters give off good vibes — includes elevated feelings of affection such as tenderness, sympathy and love, all in one package. The kind of anime which leaves you with a warm feeling inside and you can not stop smiling while watching it.

tag.name: watercolour style
tag.description: A watercolour or aquarelle is a painting method in which the paints are made of pigments suspended in a water-based solution. Some anime are created in the style of watercolour paintings, the watercolour style, usually with faded pastels that often give the show a warm and friendly visual presentation. In modern anime, this is generally achieved via computer effects that create an imitation of watercolour, rather than by creating real-life watercolour art. While the watercolour style is more commonly used for backgrounds, it is possible to create the entire anime in such a style.

tag.name: family without mother
tag.description: For some reason, the protagonist`s mother is no longer among the living. The much-too-early death was due to sickness or accident. This plot device adds a certain degree of tragedy to the anime, and usually has repercussions on the rest of the family. For example: the grief-stricken father and children barely function as humans; the oldest daughter has an extra burden of raising the other children, additional emphasis is given to the only female child in the family, i.e. with bishounen brother and dad in a shoujo setting. In rare cases the mother may still be alive, just not living with the rest of the family presently, i.e. on some quest or job and gone for a long time.

tag.name: short episodes
tag.description: Short episodes are regular episodes that are much shorter than the standard length. This means up to and including 10 minutes; shows with episodes that are 11 to 20 minutes in length are http://anidb.net/t6494 [half-length episodes] instead. Not to be confused with http://anidb.net/t6349 [multi-segment episodes], which are regular episodes that are split into several short segments (parts), usually with separate titles and independent storylines.

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO CHARACTER
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to character tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what characters they should be assigned to.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

episode.title: その猫マルにつき...
All About Maru the Cat...
Sono Neko Maru ni Tsuki...
episode.summary: Moe meets Maru after passing out on the street. What is this mysterious creature?

episode.title: マルといつまでもっ
Forever With the Sphere
Maru to Itsumademo!
episode.summary: Moe continues her narrative about the Sato family and Poyo`s mysterious nature.

episode.title: マルとクロ
The Sphere and Kuro
Maru to Kuro
episode.summary: Poyo has a new cat friend, Kurobe, and shows Hide why he is so dashing.

episode.title: 向こう3軒マルとなり
The Sphere`s Three Neighbors
Mukou San Ken Maru to Nari
episode.summary: Poyo earns the respect of the owners Farmer`s Market, and we meet Hide’s classmates Maki and Suzuki.

episode.title: マルはウチ
Come In, Sphere
Maru wa Uchi
episode.summary: It is the start of the New Year, and traditional beans thrown for Setsubun affect the pets of Moe, Maki, and Suzuki differently.

episode.title: マルに入ってはマルになれ
When With a Sphere, Do as the Sphere Does!
Maru ni Itte wa Maru ni Nare
episode.summary: Poyo is acting as a surrogate mother for the orphaned kittens, while the Saito’s search for adopters. But spending time with Poyo, each kitten is developing a unique trait.

episode.title: 雪の降るマルは♪
Snow Falling on Spheres
Yuki no Furu Maru wa
episode.summary: Kurobe, the cat next door, is missing. The old lady next door has enlisted the Sato family and friends to help find him.

episode.title: マルよ来い
Come, Sphere
Maru yo Koi
episode.summary: Moe works out during the winter season, Poyo gives up his secret base, and a girl will wear anything in the cold to look cute.

episode.title: 待ってたマル
The Sphere Has Been Waiting for You
Matte ta Maru
episode.summary: Granny has won an overnight trip to a hot spring but is reluctant to leave Kuro alone. Hide agrees to watch Kuro and Poyo, so Moe and Granny can enjoy the trip.

episode.title: マルがたった
The Sphere Stood Up
Maru ga Tatta
episode.summary: Moe explains the various tricks and behavior of Poyo. The other pet owners share the quirks of Kuro, Tsuku, and Daifuku.

episode.title: マルはほっかほか
The Sphere is Nice and Warm
Maru wa Hokka Hoka
episode.summary: When spring arrives the routines change around the household. Let’s check in with Poyo`s family and see how they are handling the season change.

episode.title: 恵みのマル
The Sphere of Blessings
Megumi no Maru
episode.summary: Spring is here, it’s time to show a little skin, be a little lazy, and suffer from allergies.

episode.title: マルの季節
The Season of the Sphere
Maru no Kisetsu
episode.summary: It is strawberry season and an old friend is back of Poyo`s is back. Hide, Moe, and Maki are enlisted to work at Akai’s Strawberry Field.

episode.title: きらわれのマル
The Hated Sphere
Kiraware no Maru
episode.summary: The Sato’s have new neighbors, the Tanakas. The Wife, Yuka is afraid of animals; how will she react to Poyo?

episode.title: マルぱしゃり
Sphere Snapshots
Maru Pashari
episode.summary: Moe is determined to get Poyo into cat magazines. Every one offers their own version of what it will take to make it happen. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: マルはたたかう
The Sphere Fights
Maru wa Tatakau
episode.summary: The Legacy of Poyo continues around the neighborhood, but does anyone know what he is? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: なぞなマル
Mysterious Sphere
Nazo na Maru
episode.summary: A sudden phone call causes Moe to run out of the house leaving her Papa worried. And Yuka-san provides great story material for Hide. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: マルハゲ
Sphere Baldness
Maru Hage
episode.summary: A new house is being built in the area where the cats like to play; Poyo gets himself in a sticky situation. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: モテマル
A Real Ladies` Sphere
Mote Maru
episode.summary: A new cat is in the neighborhood causing unexpected trouble for Poyo. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: マル日和
The Sphere Weather
Maru Biyori
episode.summary: Moe attempts to create a Poyo steamed cake, Grandma learns to appreciate her Kuro, and Poyo might be a superhero! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: マルくせ
The Sphere`s Habits
Maru Kuse
episode.summary: We get a peek into the favorite phrases and habits of cat owners. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: マル奉行
Sphere Magistrate
Maru Bugyou
episode.summary: Poyo is the unofficial ruler of the neighborhood, but what happens when one of this subjects become a temporary housemate? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: しとしとマルマル
Drizzle, Drizzle, Sphere, Sphere
Shito Shito Maru Maru
episode.summary: Everybody spends their time different on a rainy day, animals and humans alike. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ツユガマル
Rain and Toads on Spheres
Tsuyu ga Maru
episode.summary: During the rainy season cabin fever sets in and guardian spirit comes out. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: マルしゃりましょう
Let`s Do Some Sphere-ious Tidying
Marusharimashou
episode.summary: The Sato household is on a cleaning spree! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: アロハマル
Aloha Sphere
Aloha Maru
episode.summary: The heat is bad and everybody is dealing with it in their own special way. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: マルごとナツ
Summer All A-Round
Marugoto Natsu
episode.summary: The summer season continues and we focus this time on Kurobe and Hide. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 夏色のマル
The Summer-Colored Sphere
Natsu-iro no Maru
episode.summary: Summer has come and everyone handles it a different way. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ささのはマールマル
The Bamboo Leaves Rustle in the Spheres
Sasa no Ha Maaru Maru
episode.summary: Cats and Humans a like enjoy Tanabata. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: マルコロ
Spherely-Poly
Maru Koro
episode.summary: Food can be a power weapon or super cute, as everything is better when it looks like Poyo! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 夏の一番マルい日
The Roundest Day of the Summer
Natsu no Ichiban Marui Hi
episode.summary: Cucumbers, watermelons, and snakes all make for great summer snacks. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: お盆はマルく
The Lantern Festival Should Be Round
Obon wa Maruku
episode.summary: Chikuba~ Chikuba~ Poyo~ Poyo~ Hya~ Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: マルサマーミステリー
Round Summer Mystery
Maru Summer Mystery
episode.summary: A monk has come to perform a Buddhist memorial service and runs into Poyo. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: けっこう毛だらけマル, 丸だらけ
Fur Everywhere, Spheres Everywhere
Kekkou Kedarake Maru, Marudarake
episode.summary: It`s all about pet hair and beauty salons. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: マルがまるして丸とやら~
The Sphere Circled Round or Whatever
Maru ga Maru Shite Maru to yaraa
episode.summary: Moe has an obvious addiction to all that is round. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: マルのとなりにマルがいた
Next to the Sphere Was Another Sphere
Maru no Tonari ni Maru ga Ita
episode.summary: It is the season for Chrysanthemum. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ゴロピカマルッシャーン
Rumble, Flash, Spheres Pouring Down
Goro Pika Marusshaan
episode.summary: The weather turns the conversation into a game of “What If”? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 盆のようなマルだった
It Was a Sphere Like a Lantern
Bon no You na Maru Datta
episode.summary: Living with Poyo pays off at the sports fest and Papa Sato doesn’t fool around with thieves. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 地球がとってもマルいから
Because the World Is So Round
Chikyuu ga Tottemo Marui kara
episode.summary: What would happen if Poyo went to space… or was from space? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 秋ふかしまるはなにをするマルぞ
As Autumn Deepens, What Does the Sphere Do?
Aki Fukashi Maru wa Nani o Suru Maru zo
episode.summary: The colder air makes everyone a bit rounder. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ファイトなマル一発!
A Fighting Sphere Shot!
Fight na Maru Ippatsu!
episode.summary: How strong are the members of the Sato family? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 小さいマル見つけた.
I Found a Tiny Sphere
Chiisai Maru Mitsuketa.
episode.summary: All about Daifuku! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: マルマルもやもや
Round, Round, Grumble and Frown
Maru Maru Moya Moya
episode.summary: A cat never forgives and never forgets. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 読む見るマル
Read, See, Sphere
Yomu Miru Maru
episode.summary: Does Poyo have what it takes to be a model? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: クリよりうまいマルだった
It Was a Sphere Tastier Than a Chestnut
Kuri yori Umai Maru Datta
episode.summary: Meat, potatoes, and a little weight gain. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: くしゃみ3回マル3錠
Sneeze Three Times, Take Three Spheres
Kushami 3-kai Maru 3-jou
episode.summary: Hide is sick and Poyo is there to help. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 愛とマルと
With Love and Spheres
Ai to Maru to
episode.summary: How do you stay warm in the winter? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 戦国のマルのその後マル
The Sphere of Warring States, Round 2
Sengoku no Maru no Sono Ato Maru
episode.summary: Moe has been transported back to warring states era and she is getting married?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: おしつマルました
Round the End of the Year
Oshitsumarumashita
episode.summary: What do you do to celebrate the end of the year? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 人生マルありゃ全部マル.
Where There Are Spheres in Life, Life Is All Spheres.
Jinsei Maru Arya Zenbu Maru.
episode.summary: The 50th Episode Reference-loaded Extravaganza! Hya~ Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 戦国のマルのその前マル
The Sphere of Warring States, Round 1
Sengoku no Maru no Sono Mae Maru
episode.summary: Moe has been transported back to warring states era. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: またマル日までー
Until We Come `Round Again
Mata Maru Hi madee
episode.summary: So long, round cat. Source: crunchyroll
